subject: PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIAN, JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: Rio Tinto (RIO AT) approves additional USD 302mln investment in Arizona copper project
content:
AUSTRALIA

Caltex (CTX AT) - Co. completes AUD 260.2mln off market buyback. (Newswires)

Decmil Group (DCG AT) - Co. receives AUD 105mln contract. (Newswires)

Iluka Resources (ILU AT) - Co. Q1 mineral sands output 197.2k tons vs. Prev. 280.5k tons Y/Y. (Newswires)

Perpetual (PPT AT) - Co. is said to be considering making acquisitions in funds management. (Newswires)

Rio Tinto (RIO AT) - Co. approves additional USD 302mln investment in Arizona copper project which has the potential to supply around 25% of US demand. (Newswires)

Woolworths (WOW AT) - Co. plan to offload its liquor and pub unit is reportedly looking doubtful. (Newswires)

Other News - China officials told the WTO that Australia's restriction on Chinese 5G technology is discriminative and appear to violate WTO rules. (Newswires)

 

JAPAN

Bridgestone (5108 JT) - Co. won a tire design rights suit in Beijing. (Newswires)

Chiyoda (8185 JT) - Co. FY18/19 net fell 65.2% Y/Y to JPY 1.6bln. (Newswires)

Japan Display (6740 JT) - Co.’s government-led LCD JV with Hitachi (6501 JT), Sony (6758 JT) and Toshiba (6502 JT) accepts JPY 80bln bailout from China and Taiwan. (Nikkei)

Renesas (6723 JT) - Co. is mulling reducing its Japanese distributors to 6 from 16 as part of plan to restructure its sales network. (Nikkei)

Suzuki Motor (7269 JT) - Co. is to book a loss of JPY 80bln for FY18 related to recall of 2.0mln vehicles. (Nikkei) - Co. is reportedly planning JPY 170bln investment in 5 years on quality improvement. (Newswires)

Toho (9602 JT) - Co. FY18/19 net fell 10% Y/Y to JPY 30.2bln. (Newswires)

Other News - KKR founder see Japan as their “highest priority” outside of the US as non-core subsidiaries from conglomerates such as Hitachi, Toshiba and Panasonic provide lucrative opportunities for private equity. (FT)

 

SOUTH KOREA

Daewoo Shipbuilding & Marine (042660 KS) - Co. receives KRW 1.16tln contract for 3 submarines. (Newswires)

Hyundai Motor (005280 KS) - Co. Number 3 plant in Beijing has partially suspended its operation. (Newswires)

Samsung Electronics (005930 KS) - Co. Galaxy S10 1st week sales were 16% higher than the S9 last year. (Newswires)

Other News - US President Trump tweeted that he agrees that his personal relationship with North Korea leader Kim remains very good and that a 3rd summit between the leaders would be good. (Newswires)

subject: Moody's says Australian house prices will continue to decline over the next 12 months
40% of CFOs expect BoE to hike rates over next 12 months vs. Prev. 58% in the prior quarter, according to a Deloitte survey
New Zealand Performance of Services Index (Mar) 52.9 (Prev. 53.8)
ECB's Villeroy says monetary policy must stay accommodative, adds there is  no global recession in sight
Nordea Markets have gone long EUR/USD with a target of 1.1650 and will consider a stop loss of 1.1187
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights include New Zealand Performance of Services Indexn and Indian WPI
Finland Social Democrats and Nationalist Finns Party are almost tied in first place following the final results of the general election with 17.7% and 17.5% of votes respectively
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
GLOBAL

IMF stated that global expansion continues but at a weaker pace than anticipated in October last year, while it added that risks remain tilted to the downside and that global growth will firm up next year. (Newswires) 

ASIA-PAC

BoJ Governor Kuroda commented that markets fully understand BoJ’s intention to patiently persist with its easing and added that the BoJ has room to ease further if required. (Newswires)

US and China have agreed to measures that US officials believe will encourage China to avoid currency manipulation by requiring enhanced disclosure of economic actions, according to sources. (WSJ)

China officials told the WTO that Australia's restriction on Chinese 5G technology is discriminative and appear to violate WTO rules. (Newswires)

  • Chinese New Yuan Loans (CNY)(Mar) 1690B vs. Exp. 1200.0B (Prev. 885.8B). (Newswires)
  • Chinese Aggregate Financing (CNY)(Mar) 2860B vs. Exp. 1850B (Prev. 703B). (Newswires)
  • Chinese M2 Money Supply (Mar) Y/Y 8.6% vs. Exp. 8.2% (Prev. 8.0%)

 

  • Chinese Trade Balance (USD)(Mar) 32.64B vs. Exp. 7.05B (Prev. 4.08B)
  • Chinese Exports (USD)(Mar) Y/Y 14.2% vs. Exp. 7.3% (Prev. -20.8%)
  • Chinese Imports (USD)(Mar) Y/Y -7.6% vs. Exp. -1.3% (Prev. -5.2%)
  • Chinese Trade Balance (CNY)(Mar) 221.2B vs. Exp. 76.6B (Prev. 34.46B). (Newswires)
  • Chinese Exports (CNY)(Mar) Y/Y 21.3% vs. Exp. 14.8% (Prev. -16.6%)
  • Chinese Imports (CNY)(Mar) Y/Y -1.8% vs. Exp. -9.6% (Prev. -0.3%)

 

  • Indian Industrial Output (Feb) Y/Y 0.1% vs. Exp. 2.0% (Prev. 1.7%). (Newswires)
  • Indian CPI Inflation (Mar) Y/Y 2.86% vs. Exp. 2.8% (Prev. 2.57%)

 

UK/EU

UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Hammond said the government is prepared to talk about a customs union, while he also reportedly hinted that PM May could stay on as PM until October. (Newswires/PoliticsHome)

UK Cabinet Office Minister Lidington said would like government and Labour to agree on a binding mechanism for a way forward, while he added there is still a possibility for customs union compromises and that the government remains against a second referendum. (Newswires)

Former Conservative Party leader Iain Duncan Smith has called on UK PM May to resign next month and said that her timetable to resign should stand even though she has so far failed to pass the withdrawal agreement. (Guardian)

EU Commission reportedly made a list of US imports to potentially impose tariffs on due to the Boeing (BA) WTO case which target around EUR 20bln of US goods include tractors, video game consoles, motorcycle parts and cotton, according to an EU diplomat. (Newswires)

ECB President Draghi (Dovish) reiterated that ample degree of monetary accommodation remains necessary, while he also commented that risk-taking in parts of the financial and real estate markets contributed to mild signs of overstretched valuations in some areas and that risks continued to grow in the non-bank financial sector. (Newswires)

ECB's Weidmann (hawk) said trade disputes are weighing on the global economy and further escalation cannot be ruled out, while he added that Brexit also adds to uncertainty and businesses holding back investment. (Newswires)

ECB’s Vasiliauskas said negative interest-rate policy has been effective at supporting the economy, while he doesn’t see a need for a change and is not very keen on tiering. (Newswires)

ECB's nowcasting model signalled 0.2% growth in Q1 and a possible slight slowdown in Q2, according to sources. (Newswires)

S&P affirmed Germany at AAA, Outlook Stable. (Newswires)

  • EU Industrial Production (Feb) M/M -0.2% vs. Exp. -0.6% (Prev. 1.4%, Rev. 1.9%). (Newswires)
  • EU Industrial Production (Feb) Y/Y -0.3% vs. Exp. -1.0% (Prev. -1.1%, Rev. -0.7%)

 

FX

SNB Chairman Jordan said he sees no reason to alter monetary policy but added that they are still willing to intervene if required. (Newswires)

 

COMMODITIES

Baker Hughes (April 12): oil rigs +2 at 833, gas rigs -5 at 189, total rigs -3 at 1022. (Newswires)

GEOPOLITICS

US President Trump tweeted that he agrees that his personal relationship with North Korea leader Kim remains very good and that a 3rd summit between the leaders would be good. (Newswires) 

US

US President Trump suggested the stock market would have been higher by 5000-10000 points and GDP would be well above 4% instead of 3% if the Fed had done its job correctly, while he added quantitative tightening was a killer and the Fed should have done the opposite. (Twitter)

US Treasury Secretary Mnuchin stated that there are commitments both US and China are making and suggested that they were close to the final round, while he also noted that imbalances must be addressed across Europe. (Newswires)

MARKET RECAP

Anadarko (APC) shares shot higher after news emerged that Chevron (CVX) was to acquire its smaller peer at USD 65 per share. Chevron shares fell on news of the deal. Occidental Petroleum Corp (OXY) shares fell on the open, after reports that it had made a bid for Anadarko but been rejected. Disney (DIS) shares opened at all-time highs after the film production co. held a press conference which revealed new details about its soon to be released Disney+ online streaming service. Rival online streaming co. Netflix (NFLX) shares fell at the open. JP Morgan Chase (JPM) shares opened higher after the firm released its Q1 earnings report, where it beat expectations across the board, most notably in EPS and revenue. On the earnings optimism, other big investment banks (GS, MS, BAC, C) also opened higher and held on to gains throughout the session. An outlier was Wells Fargo (WFC), whose shares initially opened higher after the bank beat earnings expectations before falling lower after its CFO announced that they expected NII to fall up to 5%. PG&E (PCG) shares shot higher as news emerged that California Governor Newton had issued a report laying out a fire fund for utilities, a possible form of financial assistance for the energy utility company. SPX +0.66% at 2908, NDX +0.44% at 7628, DJI +1% at 26412.

Following an upbeat set of China data, that reassured investors about the stabilisation seen in the World’s second largest economy, the risk tone became constructive, although the reaction was somewhat delayed. The result was selling of the Treasury curve, and yields are higher by between 4bps and 6.5bps at settlement. The selling saw a pause after a soft Michigan survey, which lifted the T-Note off of lows. Major curve spreads were mixed into a quiet close. US T-note futures (M9) settled 15 ticks lower at 123-03.

subject: Barclays says its trade of the week is long USD/ZAR with a target of 14.27 and stop at 13.82
Reports note tsunami warning from a magnitude 7 earthquake which hit Indonesia on Saturday has been lifted
ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
